{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accounts Associate",
  "description": "Volition Capital was set up to help the honest and hardworking to create wealth. We fulfill our mandate through investment education, cooperatives and partnerships with credible local and international investment companies. Our target audience is working professionals and retirees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Accounts Associate
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Mode of Engagement: Full-time with a probation period of 6 months.
Reporting Line: Senior Accountant

Roles &amp; Responsibilities


	Assist in the preparation of financial statements, including cash flow and budget performance reports.
	Perform reconciliations for bank statements, ledgers, and invoices.
	Support compliance with applicable standards (i.e., IFRS, GAAP) and regulatory requirements, including SEC rules and Cooperative statutes.
	Process and document payments on bank platforms.
	Maintain records for asset registers, invoices, and operational expenses.
	Assist with monthly management account preparation and financial reporting.
	Provide timely and accurate financial information to the Accountant and management.
	Collaborate with external auditors by organizing and supplying required documentation.
	Ensure timely remittances and filings of taxes and statutory deductions.
	Support currency sourcing/swap activities and weekly payment disbursements.


Qualifications, Skill Sets, and Values


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2-3 years of accounting or finance experience.
	Progress toward becoming a Chartered Accountant is an advantage.
	Demonstrable knowledge of IFRS and financial reporting standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office applications.
	Familiarity with general ledger accounting, reconciliations, and financial statement preparation.
	Experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks).
	Understanding of tax filings and compliance requirements.
	Strong organisational and numeracy skills with keen attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Remuneration &amp; Perks


	Competitive remuneration in line with industry benchmarks.
	Health insurance.
	Work-from-home options
	Staff-only investment opportunities.
	High degree of autonomy &amp; flexibility.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-23",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-24",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Volition Capital"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189274"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Accounts Associate Job at Volition Capital




        
    

        
        Volition Capital was set up to help the honest and hardworking to create wealth. We fulfill our mandate through investment education, cooperatives and partnerships with credible local and international investment companies. Our target audience is working professionals and retirees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Associate
Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Mode of Engagement: Full-time with a probation period of 6 months.
Reporting Line: Senior Accountant

Roles & Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist in the preparation of financial statements, including cash flow and budget performance reports.
	Perform reconciliations for bank statements, ledgers, and invoices.
	Support compliance with applicable standards (i.e., IFRS, GAAP) and regulatory requirements, including SEC rules and Cooperative statutes.
	Process and document payments on bank platforms.
	Maintain records for asset registers, invoices, and operational expenses.
	Assist with monthly management account preparation and financial reporting.
	Provide timely and accurate financial information to the Accountant and management.
	Collaborate with external auditors by organizing and supplying required documentation.
	Ensure timely remittances and filings of taxes and statutory deductions.
	Support currency sourcing/swap activities and weekly payment disbursements.


Qualifications, Skill Sets, and Values


	Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2-3 years of accounting or finance experience.
	Progress toward becoming a Chartered Accountant is an advantage.
	Demonstrable knowledge of IFRS and financial reporting standards.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other Microsoft Office applications.
	Familiarity with general ledger accounting, reconciliations, and financial statement preparation.
	Experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks).
	Understanding of tax filings and compliance requirements.
	Strong organisational and numeracy skills with keen attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Remuneration & Perks


	Competitive remuneration in line with industry benchmarks.
	Health insurance.
	Work-from-home options
	Staff-only investment opportunities.
	High degree of autonomy & flexibility.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Engineer",
  "description": "Yinson Holdings Berhad is a global energy infrastructure and technology company, listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad. We are a diversified global group recognised for our leadership position in sustainability, with key businesses in offshore energy, renewable energy and green technologies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Operations Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Function: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent

Overall purpose of the job


	Support the operations, maintenance and technical requirements of the Unit and office as required.


Core Responsibilities


	Monitor status of Class and Statutory Certificates, Surveys, maintain files and report on upcoming surveys
	Assist in monitoring of project and contractor&rsquo;s works ashore and on-board the Units
	Report any abnormalities in offshore units&rsquo; daily operation or production reports
	Liaise with operations and technical teams as appropriate on operational and technical matters
	Maintain office files for Instruction books and drawings
	Assist with the planning and execution of repairs, including unscheduled / urgent repairs
	Follow up contractors / suppliers and Logistics Agent regarding Landed Goods for service and repairs and keep track on status of same
	Assist in performing audits of contractors and suppliers
	Assist in Collation of operations statistics for local content and related reporting
	Office facility management including monitoring the running and maintenance of power plants, supply of fuels and lubricants and other maintenance activities as required
	Assist with collation and reporting of office HSEQ statistics, internal and external audits corrective action, implementation and other HSEQ related reporting;Comply with company HSSEQ system in performing duties
	Use of the CMMS for support to the FPSOs maintenance planning, spare parts planning, project management, document management, asset and service management, etc.


HSE responsibilities:


	Responsible for maintaining a high degree of awareness; Lead by doing; setting an example for others;
	Observe and report any unsafe activities, conditions or situations; If you observe anything unsafe use the &lsquo;Stop Work&rsquo; Policy.


Qualifications / Skills / Experience required


	A Bachelor or Master&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a similar position, preferably in the offshore Oil &amp; Gas or Maritime industry;
	Possession of marine Engineer License is an advantage;
	Proficient in MS Office Suite and use of ERP or procurement systems.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-24",

  },

Operations Engineer Job at Yinson Holdings Berhad




        
    

        
        Yinson Holdings Berhad is a global energy infrastructure and technology company, listed on the Main Market of Bursa Malaysia Securities Berhad. We are a diversified global group recognised for our leadership position in sustainability, with key businesses in offshore energy, renewable energy and green technologies.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Function: Operations
Employment Type: Permanent

Overall purpose of the job
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Support the operations, maintenance and technical requirements of the Unit and office as required.


Core Responsibilities


	Monitor status of Class and Statutory Certificates, Surveys, maintain files and report on upcoming surveys
	Assist in monitoring of project and contractor’s works ashore and on-board the Units
	Report any abnormalities in offshore units’ daily operation or production reports
	Liaise with operations and technical teams as appropriate on operational and technical matters
	Maintain office files for Instruction books and drawings
	Assist with the planning and execution of repairs, including unscheduled / urgent repairs
	Follow up contractors / suppliers and Logistics Agent regarding Landed Goods for service and repairs and keep track on status of same
	Assist in performing audits of contractors and suppliers
	Assist in Collation of operations statistics for local content and related reporting
	Office facility management including monitoring the running and maintenance of power plants, supply of fuels and lubricants and other maintenance activities as required
	Assist with collation and reporting of office HSEQ statistics, internal and external audits corrective action, implementation and other HSEQ related reporting;Comply with company HSSEQ system in performing duties
	Use of the CMMS for support to the FPSOs maintenance planning, spare parts planning, project management, document management, asset and service management, etc.


HSE responsibilities:


	Responsible for maintaining a high degree of awareness; Lead by doing; setting an example for others;
	Observe and report any unsafe activities, conditions or situations; If you observe anything unsafe use the ‘Stop Work’ Policy.


Qualifications / Skills / Experience required


	A Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Engineering.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a similar position, preferably in the offshore Oil & Gas or Maritime industry;
	Possession of marine Engineer License is an advantage;
	Proficient in MS Office Suite and use of ERP or procurement systems.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "Total Child School is a co-educational Nursery, Primary and Secondary School. The school is sited at a serene location providing a beautiful, natural and highly conducive atmosphere for learning. The School promises every child a privileged, purposeful, enriching, very enjoyable and memorable school life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Accountant

Job Locations:&nbsp;Victoria Island &amp; Abijo (Awoyaya), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all financial transactions.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Monitor budgets, expenditures, and financial performance across departments.
	Prepare and process payments, invoices, and payroll accurately and on time.
	Reconcile bank statements and ensure the integrity of all financial records.
	Ensure compliance with internal financial controls, accounting standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Assist in preparing budgets and forecasts in collaboration with relevant departments.
	Manage petty cash and monitor school fees and receivables.
	Support internal and external audits by providing required documentation and explanations.
	Advise on cost reduction, financial risks, and resource optimization.
	Maintain an organized filing system of financial records for audit and management review.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2 - 3 years of experience in a similar accounting role, preferably in an educational or non-profit environment.
	Professional qualification (e.g., ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	Previous experience in a school or tertiary institution is an added advantage.
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or similar) and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong understanding of Nigerian tax laws, payroll, and regulatory requirements.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;s.totalchild@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Accountant Job at Total Child School




        
    

        
        Total Child School is a co-educational Nursery, Primary and Secondary School. The school is sited at a serene location providing a beautiful, natural and highly conducive atmosphere for learning. The School promises every child a privileged, purposeful, enriching, very enjoyable and memorable school life.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Locations: Victoria Island & Abijo (Awoyaya), Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all financial transactions.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
	Monitor budgets, expenditures, and financial performance across departments.
	Prepare and process payments, invoices, and payroll accurately and on time.
	Reconcile bank statements and ensure the integrity of all financial records.
	Ensure compliance with internal financial controls, accounting standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Assist in preparing budgets and forecasts in collaboration with relevant departments.
	Manage petty cash and monitor school fees and receivables.
	Support internal and external audits by providing required documentation and explanations.
	Advise on cost reduction, financial risks, and resource optimization.
	Maintain an organized filing system of financial records for audit and management review.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.
	2 - 3 years of experience in a similar accounting role, preferably in an educational or non-profit environment.
	Professional qualification (e.g., ICAN, ACCA) is an added advantage.
	Previous experience in a school or tertiary institution is an added advantage.
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or similar) and Microsoft Excel.
	Strong understanding of Nigerian tax laws, payroll, and regulatory requirements.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: s.totalchild@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Officer",
  "description": "Lesso Group, established in 1986, (Stock Code: 02128.HK) is a global leader in home furnishings and building materials. The Group&#39;s business portfolio spans plastic piping, building materials and home furnishings, environmental protection, new energy, supply-chain service platforms and others. It offers a wide range of products such as pipes, photovoltaics, plumbing and sanitary ware, integral kitchen materials, integral doors and windows, aluminum formwork and smart scaffolds, water purifiers, water-proofing materials and sealants, fire-fighting equipment, valves, cables, lighting, hygiene materials, items for environmental protection, agricultural facilities, and oceanic aquaculture cages. In 2023, LESSO&#39;s sales revenue reached over USD 4.38 billion.

Since implementing a strategy of globalization and expanding its global presence, LESSO has evolved into a sophisticated multinational. It boasts more than 30 advanced production bases worldwide, broadening its industrial and sales networks to cover Asia, North America, South America, Europe, Africa, and Oceania. This enables LESSO to provide quality products and services for global customers in accordance with its continuously improved strategic layout in a timely and efficient way.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Officer, supervise the efficient receipt, storage, and dispatch of raw materials and finished products (pipes and adult sanitary pads).
	The role ensures effective inventory control, staff supervision, logistics coordination, and compliance with safety and quality standards to support continuous manufacturing and distribution operations.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse Operations Management:


	Supervise the daily operations of the warehouse, including receiving, storing, picking, packing, and dispatching of goods.
	Ensure proper storage of pipes (large, heavy, or long materials) and sanitary pads (lightweight, hygiene- sensitive products) according to product handling requirements.
	Develop efficient warehouse layouts to optimize space utilization and product accessibility.
	Monitor loading and unloading activities to prevent product damage and ensure accuracy.


Inventory &amp; Stock Control:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records using warehouse management systems (WMS) or ERP tools.
	Conduct regular stock counts, cycle counts, and reconciliations to detect variances early.
	Manage reorder levels for raw materials, packaging materials, and finished goods.
	Implement FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First-Expired, First-Out) inventory principles, especially for sanitary pads.
	Monitor and report on stock movement, slow-moving items, and obsolete materials.


Logistics &amp; Dispatch Coordination:


	Coordinate dispatch schedules with the Sales and Distribution Teams to ensure timely deliveries.
	Oversee packaging and loading of products for local and interstate deliveries.
	Liaise with transporters and logistics partners for efficient product movement.
	Ensure documentation accuracy &mdash; delivery notes, waybills, shipment manifests, and receipts.


Warehouse Staff Supervision:


	Lead, train, and supervise warehouse staff (storekeepers, loaders, forklift operators, and inventory clerks).
	Plan and assign daily tasks, monitor performance, and ensure adherence to standard operating procedures
	(SOPs).
	Enforce discipline, safety, and productivity standards among warehouse staff.
	Conduct periodic staff training on product handling, hygiene, and equipment use.


Safety, Hygiene &amp; Quality Assurance:


	Maintain a clean, organized, and hazard-free warehouse environment.
	Enforce compliance with health and safety standards (especially for sanitary pad hygiene storage).
	Inspect materials and finished products for damage, contamination, or quality issues.
	Ensure proper ventilation, temperature, and humidity control where required.
	Oversee proper labeling, stacking, and segregation of different product types.


Documentation &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing goods.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly warehouse reports (stock levels, dispatches, shortages, etc.).
	Support internal and external audits by providing inventory and movement reports.
	Document material usage for production (pipes and pads) and reconcile with production reports.


Coordination with Other Departments:


	Work closely with Production, Procurement, Sales, and Finance to align warehouse operations with company needs.
	Support the Procurement Team in verifying incoming raw materials and supplies.
	Collaborate with Quality Control to ensure that products meet company standards before dispatch.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND qualification with 2 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary
N120,000 monthly.&nbsp;",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-23",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "LESSO GROUP"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189270"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 75000,
      "maxValue": 150000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Warehouse Officer Job at Lesso Group




        
    

        
        Lesso Group, established in 1986, (Stock Code: 02128.HK) is a global leader in home furnishings and building materials. The Group's business portfolio spans plastic piping, building materials and home furnishings, environmental protection, new energy, supply-chain service platforms and others. It offers a wide range of products such as pipes, photovoltaics, plumbing and sanitary ware, integral kitchen materials, integral doors and windows, aluminum formwork and smart scaffolds, water purifiers, water-proofing materials and sealants, fire-fighting equipment, valves, cables, lighting, hygiene materials, items for environmental protection, agricultural facilities, and oceanic aquaculture cages. In 2023, LESSO's sales revenue reached over USD 4.38 billion.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Since implementing a strategy of globalization and expanding its global presence, LESSO has evolved into a sophisticated multinational. It boasts more than 30 advanced production bases worldwide, broadening its industrial and sales networks to cover Asia, North America, South America, Europe, Africa, and Oceania. This enables LESSO to provide quality products and services for global customers in accordance with its continuously improved strategic layout in a timely and efficient way.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Warehouse Officer, supervise the efficient receipt, storage, and dispatch of raw materials and finished products (pipes and adult sanitary pads).
	The role ensures effective inventory control, staff supervision, logistics coordination, and compliance with safety and quality standards to support continuous manufacturing and distribution operations.


Key Responsibilities
Warehouse Operations Management:


	Supervise the daily operations of the warehouse, including receiving, storing, picking, packing, and dispatching of goods.
	Ensure proper storage of pipes (large, heavy, or long materials) and sanitary pads (lightweight, hygiene- sensitive products) according to product handling requirements.
	Develop efficient warehouse layouts to optimize space utilization and product accessibility.
	Monitor loading and unloading activities to prevent product damage and ensure accuracy.


Inventory & Stock Control:


	Maintain accurate and up-to-date inventory records using warehouse management systems (WMS) or ERP tools.
	Conduct regular stock counts, cycle counts, and reconciliations to detect variances early.
	Manage reorder levels for raw materials, packaging materials, and finished goods.
	Implement FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First-Expired, First-Out) inventory principles, especially for sanitary pads.
	Monitor and report on stock movement, slow-moving items, and obsolete materials.


Logistics & Dispatch Coordination:


	Coordinate dispatch schedules with the Sales and Distribution Teams to ensure timely deliveries.
	Oversee packaging and loading of products for local and interstate deliveries.
	Liaise with transporters and logistics partners for efficient product movement.
	Ensure documentation accuracy — delivery notes, waybills, shipment manifests, and receipts.


Warehouse Staff Supervision:


	Lead, train, and supervise warehouse staff (storekeepers, loaders, forklift operators, and inventory clerks).
	Plan and assign daily tasks, monitor performance, and ensure adherence to standard operating procedures
	(SOPs).
	Enforce discipline, safety, and productivity standards among warehouse staff.
	Conduct periodic staff training on product handling, hygiene, and equipment use.


Safety, Hygiene & Quality Assurance:


	Maintain a clean, organized, and hazard-free warehouse environment.
	Enforce compliance with health and safety standards (especially for sanitary pad hygiene storage).
	Inspect materials and finished products for damage, contamination, or quality issues.
	Ensure proper ventilation, temperature, and humidity control where required.
	Oversee proper labeling, stacking, and segregation of different product types.


Documentation & Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records of all incoming and outgoing goods.
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly warehouse reports (stock levels, dispatches, shortages, etc.).
	Support internal and external audits by providing inventory and movement reports.
	Document material usage for production (pipes and pads) and reconcile with production reports.


Coordination with Other Departments:


	Work closely with Production, Procurement, Sales, and Finance to align warehouse operations with company needs.
	Support the Procurement Team in verifying incoming raw materials and supplies.
	Collaborate with Quality Control to ensure that products meet company standards before dispatch.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an OND / HND qualification with 2 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary
N120,000 monthly.
